Issues.Title: Clarity needed on `resource` use cases
Issues.Body:
### Describe the problem that you experienced

The docs contain contradictions regarding the purpose of resources:

> You can use a Resource to perform any kind of async operation, but the most common use-case for Resource is fetching data from a server. The following example creates a resource to fetch some user data.

https://angular.dev/guide/signals/resource


> Note that resource is intended for read operations, not operations which perform mutations. resource will cancel in-progress loads via the AbortSignal when destroyed or when a new request object becomes available, which could prematurely abort mutations.

https://angular.dev/api/core/resource#description

### Enter the URL of the topic with the problem

See description

### Describe what you were looking for in the documentation

See description

### Describe the actions that led you to experience the problem

Discussing resources with non-GET loaders

https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/58920

### Describe what you want to experience that would fix the problem

Preferably, expand `resource` to consider mutations as a viable use-case. I understand this would require reconsidering the AbortSignal and it may be better suited for a separate API.

Regardless, the docs should be consistent.

### Add a screenshot if that helps illustrate the problem

_No response_

```true

```

### If the problem is browser-specific, please specify the device, OS, browser, and version

```true

```

### Provide any additional information here in as much as detail as you can

```true

```

Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist:

## PR Type:
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.dev application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:

## PR Description:
Right now, `HttpFeature` only accepts `Provider[]`, which makes it harder to extend the HTTP client with custom features. This change lets it also accept `EnvironmentProviders`, making it easier to customize things like interceptors or backend replacements. `provideHttpClient()` already converts providers to `EnvironmentProviders`, so this just makes the API more consistent. ðŸš€

Issues.Title: docs(docs-infra): fix card highlighting in the API reference details page
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [x] angular.dev application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Member cards use `pointer-events: none` in order to prevent highlighting on member card interaction (clicks, text selection, etc.). This, however, blocks other interactions that should be available like scrolling.

## What is the new behavior?

Currently, the member cards highlighting relies on element focus which doesn't seem very right by itself given we enforce `tabIndex=-1`. The highlighting should be active when the user clicks on a member/property which, respectively, adds a fragment to the URL, scrolls the page down and adds an outline to the specific card. Since using `pointer-events: none` in order to prevent highlighting on card click is problematic, the new solution delegates the highlighting entirely to JS.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

Issues.Title: ng19 Component Library Components not recognizing provider DatePipe
Issues.Body:
### Command serve ### Is this a regression? - [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version ### The previous version in which this bug was not present was _No response_ ### Description While migrating a Component Library to Angular 19 and removing NgModules, I encountered a runtime error stating "No provider for DatePipe", despite explicitly importing and providing DatePipe within the components that require it. Interestingly, the component library builds successfully without needing a module to provide DatePipe. However, the application only runs if I add DatePipe to the providers array in main.ts within my test harness. This shouldnâ€™t be a requirement for a component libraryâ€”I want to avoid tightly coupling the library to any consuming application in this way. ### Minimal Reproduction Here are the steps to reproduce the issue: ### **Steps to Reproduce the "No Provider for DatePipe" Error in Angular 19 Component Library** #### **1. Create a New Angular Component Library** - Generate a new Angular workspace with a library: ```sh ng new my-workspace --create-application=false cd my-workspace ng generate library my-lib ``` - Navigate to the `projects/my-lib` directory. #### **2. Create a Component That Uses `DatePipe`** - Inside `projects/my-lib/src/lib/`, create a new component: ```sh ng generate component date-display ``` - Modify `date-display.component.ts` to use `DatePipe`: ```typescript import { Component, Inject } from '@angular/core'; import { DatePipe } from '@angular/common'; @Component({ selector: 'lib-date-display', template: '

{{ today | date }}

', providers: [DatePipe] // Providing DatePipe here }) export class DateDisplayComponent { today = new Date(); constructor(private datePipe: DatePipe) { console.log(this.datePipe.transform(this.today, 'longDate')); } } ``` #### **3. Ensure `NgModule` is Removed (Standalone Component)** - Modify `date-display.component.ts` to make it a standalone component: ```typescript @Component({ selector: 'lib-date-display', standalone: true, template: '

{{ today | date }}

', providers: [DatePipe] // Providing DatePipe here }) export class DateDisplayComponent { today = new Date(); constructor(private datePipe: DatePipe) { console.log(this.datePipe.transform(this.today, 'longDate')); } } ``` #### **4. Build the Library** - Run: ```sh ng build my-lib ``` - The build should succeed without errors. #### **5. Create a Test Application** - Generate a new Angular application to test the library: ```sh ng generate application test-app ``` - Add the library to the application: ```sh ng add my-lib ``` #### **6. Use the Component in the Test Application** - Open `test-app/src/app/app.component.html` and add: ```html ``` - Open `test-app/src/app/app.component.ts` and import the standalone component: ```typescript import { Component } from '@angular/core'; import { DateDisplayComponent } from 'my-lib'; @Component({ selector: 'app-root', standalone: true, imports: [DateDisplayComponent], template: '' }) export class AppComponent {} ``` #### **7. Run the Application** ```sh ng serve test-app ``` - **Expected Behavior:** The app should run without issues. - **Actual Behavior:** A runtime error occurs: ``` Error: NG0203: No provider for DatePipe! ``` #### **8. Workaround: Add `DatePipe` to `main.ts`** - Modify `test-app/src/main.ts` to provide `DatePipe` globally: ```typescript import { bootstrapApplication } from '@angular/platform-browser'; import { AppComponent } from './app/app.component'; import { provideHttpClient } from '@angular/common/http'; import { DatePipe } from '@angular/common'; bootstrapApplication(AppComponent, { providers: [DatePipe] }); ``` - **Now the application runs correctly.** ### **Issue Summary** - The component library builds successfully. - Despite providing `DatePipe` at the component level, Angular still throws a "No Provider" error at runtime. - The app only works when `DatePipe` is provided at the application level (`main.ts`), which **forces tight coupling** between the library and the consuming application. ### **Expected Behavior** - Since `DatePipe` is provided in the standalone component, the app should not require an additional provider in `main.ts`. - The component library should be self-contained and not require the consuming application to explicitly provide `DatePipe`. Let me know if you need any refinements! ðŸš€ ### Exception or Error ```text ERROR NullInjectorError: R3InjectorError(Standalone[_MapMainComponent])[_MapMessageService -> _MapMessageService -> _MapToolsMenubarComponent -> _MenuBarImportService -> _MenuBarImportService -> _DatePipe -> _DatePipe]: NullInjectorError: No provider for _DatePipe! ``` ### Your Environment ```text Angular CLI: 19.1.7 Node: 22.12.0 Package Manager: npm 10.9.1 OS: win32 x64 Angular: 19.1.5 ... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router Package Version --------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.1901.7 @angular-devkit/build-angular 19.1.7 @angular-devkit/core 19.1.7 (cli-only) @angular-devkit/schematics 19.1.7 @angular/cdk 17.3.10 @angular/cli 19.1.7 @angular/language-service 19.1.6 @angular/localize 19.1.6 @schematics/angular 19.1.7 ng-packagr 19.1.2 rxjs 6.6.7 typescript 5.7.3 zone.js 0.15.0 ``` ### Anything else relevant? _No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ng19 Component Library Components not recognizing provider DatePipe" (#59963)

Issues.Body:
Patch PR of #59444

This PR contains the following updates:

| [jsdom](https://redirect.github.com/jsdom/jsdom) | dependencies | major | [`~25.0.0` -> `~26.0.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/jsdom/25.0.1/26.0.0) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>jsdom/jsdom (jsdom)</summary>

### [`v26.0.0`](https://redirect.github.com/jsdom/jsdom/blob/HEAD/Changelog.md#2600)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/jsdom/jsdom/compare/25.0.1...26.0.0)

Breaking change: [`canvas`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/canvas) peer dependency requirement has been upgraded from v2 to v3. (sebastianwachter)

Other changes:

-   Added `AbortSignal.any()`. (jdbevan)
-   Added initial support for form-associated custom elements, in particular making them labelable and supporting the `ElementInternals` `labels` property. The form-associated callbacks are not yet supported. (hesxenon)
-   Updated `whatwg-url`, adding support for `URL.parse()`.
-   Updated `cssstyle` and `rrweb-cssom`, to improve CSS parsing capabilities.
-   Updated `nwsapi`, improving CSS selector matching.
-   Updated `parse5`, fixing a bug around `<noframes>` elements and HTML entity decoding.
-   Fixed `JSDOM.fromURL()` to properly reject the returned promise if the server redirects to an invalid URL, instead of causing an uncaught exception.

</details>

Issues.Title: Router Params type readonly
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

router

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

On `ActivatedRoute` the `params` member of type `Params` is readonly, but its type doesn't specify that it is readonly, See [Router shared.ts](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/packages/router/src/shared.ts#L34).

Check https://github.com/cubimon/angular-readonly-params/blob/master/src/app/app.component.ts, go to [http://localhost:4200/test;a=b](http://localhost:4200/test;a=b)

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://github.com/cubimon/angular-readonly-params/blob/master/src/app/app.component.ts

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
TypeError: Cannot assign to read only property 'id' of object '[object Object]'
```

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 18.2.14
Node: 18.20.6
Package Manager: npm 10.8.2
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 18.2.13
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1802.14
@angular-devkit/build-angular   18.2.14
@angular-devkit/core            18.2.14
@angular-devkit/schematics      18.2.14
@angular/cli                    18.2.14
@schematics/angular             18.2.14
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      5.5.4
zone.js                         0.14.10
```

### Anything else?

This is a minor issue that could be easily resolved by using `readonly` Keyword
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Router Params type readonly" (#59953)

Issues.Title: Detached html elements when "hot-reload" of development server
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

When I have the following 2 lines in an "ngOnInit()" method:
`
document.documentElement.style.setProperty('--testing', "'testing'");
console.log('force rebuild 5');
`
And have the page open with hot-reload enabled. Then when I change the number inside of console.log into something other (so the rebuild will get triggered), then the entire page is stored in RAM twice (based on Chromium/Chrome heap snapshot). One version as the one that is showed, the other version is detached. Running garbage collector does not help to remove it. 

As it is this simple to reproduce the thing I guess there is some issue in Angular, but let me know if the things should be done in a different way.
A workaround that I found is that it is possible to create <style> inside of <head>, and then a css variable will be changed, wihtout having the detached HTMLElements.


when running ng version I get the following:

Angular CLI: 18.2.6
Node: 20.18.1
Package Manager: npm 9.5.1
OS: win32 x64
 
Angular: 18.2.6
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router
 
Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1802.6
@angular-devkit/build-angular   18.2.6
@angular-devkit/core            18.2.6
@angular-devkit/schematics      18.2.6
@schematics/angular             18.2.6
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      5.5.4
zone.js                         0.14.10 

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/a4yessjv?file=src%2Fapp%2Fproduct-list%2Fproduct-list.component.ts,src%2Fapp%2Fproduct-details%2Fproduct-details.component.ts,src%2Fapp%2Fproduct-alerts%2Fproduct-alerts.component.ts

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
When I have the page open in a new tab and performance monitoring open then I can see a big increase of RAM usage any time the app does a hot-reload (such as when I change the number in the console log in 'product-details.component.ts'
```

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true

```

### Anything else?

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Detached html elements when "hot-reload" of development server" (#59951)

Issues.Title: feat(@schematics/angular): directly use `@angular/build` in new projects
Issues.Body:
The `@angular/build` package is now used directly within all newly created projects and replaces the previous usage of the `@angular-devkit/build-angular` package. This has the advantage of removing the need to install all of the Webpack related transitive dependencies contained within `@angular-devkit/build-angular` that are used to support the `browser` builder. This results in a significant reduction in both total dependency count and disk install size for new projects. New projects that would prefer to use the Webpack-based `browser` builder can still install the `@angular-devkit/build-angular` package within the workspace.

The `@angular/build@19.2.0-next.2` package currently has a total unpacked size of ~115 MB.
The `@angular-devkit/build-angular@19.2.0-next.2` package currently has a total unpacked size of ~291 MB.

Blocked on #29640

Issues.Title: feat(@angular/build): add application builder karma testing to package
Issues.Body:
An `application` only variant of the `karma` builder found within the `@angular-devkit/build-angular` package is now available within the `@angular/build` package as `@angular/build:karma`. This builder will only use the `application` builder found within `@angular/build` and does not provide the `builderMode` option as `application` would be the only valid value. Testing behavior is effectively equivalent to using the `@angular-devkit/build-angular:karma` builder with the `builderMode` option set to `application`. However, several options have been adjusted:
* `builderMode` was removed
* `fileReplacements` legacy structure (`src`/`replaceWith`) removed
* `polyfills` only accepts an array of strings
* `loader` has been added
* `define` has been added
* `externalDependencies` has been added
* `sass` sub-option for `stylePreprocessorOptions` has been added

From an implementation perspective, the test finding logic and the application builder integration have been moved to the `@angular/build` package and reused by the `@angular-devkit/build-angular` package via the private export of `@angular/build`.

Closes: #28809
Closes: #28321
Closes: #29185

Issues.Title: ng update wants to update @angular/material in project that does not have it installed
Issues.Body:
### Command

update

### Is this a regression?

- [x] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

19.1.6

### Description

Running `ng update` offers update to `@angular/material` even though it is not installed to the project. The project has `@angular/cdk` and `@angular/cdk-experimental` installed.

```
    We analyzed your package.json, there are some packages to update:

      Name                                Version                  Command to update
```

Issues.Title: add ng build cli option to mark extended diagnostics as errors
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Description

Currently there is an option to mark angular compiler warnings as errors by modifying `tsconfig.json`:
```
...
  "angularCompilerOptions": {
    "extendedDiagnostics": {
      "defaultCategory": "error"
    },
  }
...
```

For normal development (e.g. via `ng serve`), I don't want to have this option, as there might be issues (e.g. import errors) which are only temporary when editing a file.

But for the CI pipeline, the warnings should be treated as errors.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Add a CLI option (name of variable just a proposal) to treat extended diagnostics warnings as errors (like `-Werror` for C compilers):
```
ng build --extendedDiagnosticsWarnings=error
```
This would behave the same way as setting `angularCompilerOptions.extendedDiagnostics.defaultCategory` to the specified level

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Patching tsconfig in CI pipeline: this is a bit error-prone and requires additional tools in the CI image
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "add ng build cli option to mark extended diagnostics as errors" (#29636)

Issues.Title: ci: replace `bazel run @npm2//:sync` with `bazel sync --only=repo`
Issues.Body:
In certain scenarios, running `bazel run @npm2//:sync` does not reliably update the aspect lock files. For example:

```
# Update the version in package.json
$ yarn bazel run @npm2//:sync  # Lock file is updated
$ git restore .aspect
$ yarn bazel run @npm2//:sync  # Lock file is NOT updated
```

Switching to `bazel sync --only=repo` guarantees that the lock file is consistently updated.

More context: https://angular-team.slack.com/archives/C042EU9T5/p1739398554132249
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "ci: replace `bazel run @npm2//:sync` with `bazel sync --only=repo`" (#29631)

Issues.Title: fix(material/button): combine MatButton and MatAnchor
Issues.Body:
Currently we have two directives for each button variant: `MatButton` which applies to `button` elements and `MatButtonAnchor` which applies to anchors.

This is problematic in a couple of ways:
1. The styles, which can be non-trivial, are duplicated if both classes are used.
2. Users have to think about which class they're importing.

These changes combine the two classes to resolve the issues and simplify our setup.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/button): combine MatButton and MatAnchor" (#30492)

Issues.Title: Docs site cleanups
Issues.Body:
Includes a bunch of cleanups for the docs site (see below) that ended up removing 230kb from the initial bundle.

### build: update the docs site to latest Angular 
Updates the docs site to the latest version of Angular.

### fix(material-angular-io): remove docs data from critical path 
The docs site was loading the data of all the examples up-front through an eager import which was bringing in ~170kb of JavaScript which isn't necessary for the initial load. These changes refactor the various call sites so that they load the example data asynchronously.

### fix(material-angular-io): remove animations dependency 
Drops the `@angular/animations` module from the docs site since it's no longer necessary. This removes another ~70kb from the initial bundle.

### refactor(material-angular-io): use standalone imports instead of modules 
Removes (almost) all of our `@NgModule` usage in the docs site by replacing their usages with standalone imports.

### refactor(material-angular-io): switch to inject function 
Runs the inject migration over the docs site to make it consistent with the rest of the repo.

### refactor(material-angular-io): remove remaining modules 
Reworks the docs site to remove all remaining `@NgModule` usages.

### build: narrow down prettier file set
Fixes that the formatting check was catching some files incorrectly, like pnpm lock file.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Docs site cleanups" (#30488)

Issues.Title: perf(material/radio): Optimize costly css selectors.
Issues.Body: Descendant selectors containing :state selectors as ancestors are slow as they require the css engine to check all the way up to the dom root for matching elements. Using child selectors instead limits the scope of these checks to just the direct parent element.

Issues.Title: Youtube-player: add support to toggle FullScreen
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

I am creating my own controls to Start (playVideo) and Pause (pauseVideo( a video and I would also like to be able to add a fullscreen button outside of the youtube-player component.
There seems to be no function available for it and I also can't `requestFullscreen` on the iframe.
Is there  away, maybe via postMessage to tell the iframe to go trigger fullscreen?
If not,  can this be provided?

The Youtube API doesn't mention anything. So I guess it is not possible.


### Use Case

Toggle fullscreen when youtube controls are disabled, outside of the youtube component.

We want to use it on a Smart TV and using the D-pad arrows on the remote to go to the fullscreen icon is not very convenient.  Being able to programatically go fullscreen should not be anymore insecure as allowing to Play or Pause, I think.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Youtube-player: add support to toggle FullScreen" (#30485)

Issues.Title: bug(bottom-sheet): auto focus defaults to dialog instead of first-tabbable
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

The documentation https://material.angular.io/components/bottom-sheet/overview#focus-management specifies that the default behavior for `autoFocus` is `first-tabbable`. However, since at least v16, the default behavior has been set to `dialog`.

This is a surprising `autoFocus` behavior from an accessibility standpoint.

This even seems to have been enshrined in the tests: https://github.com/angular/components/blob/c1ff40f/src/material/bottom-sheet/bottom-sheet.spec.ts#L620

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-starter-dd7tdtv9?file=src%2Fmain.ts
Steps to reproduce:
1. BottomSheet opens on init
2. Note that the element inside does not have focus. But it is tabbable


### Expected Behavior

First tabbable element should receive focus

### Actual Behavior

First tabbable element does not receive focus, bottom sheet container receives focus instead.

### Environment

- Angular: 18.2.8
- CDK/Material: 18.2.8
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(bottom-sheet): auto focus defaults to dialog instead of first-tabbable" (#30483)

Issues.Title: fix(cdk/overlay): avoid issues with overlapping backdrop removals
Issues.Body:
Prior to #30179 the overlay ref was able to handle multiple backdrops being removed at the same time, because we didn't need to retain any state about them, aside from the DOM node. After the switch to the renderer that's no longer the case, because we also retain the event cleanup functions. This is a problem, because they can end up overriding each other and causing events to be dropped incorrectly.

These changes move the backdrop-related logic to a new `BackdropRef` class to make the removal process easier to manage, clean up the `overlay-ref.ts` a bit and resolve the issue.

Fixes #30426.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(cdk/overlay): avoid issues with overlapping backdrop removals" (#30474)

Issues.Title: bug(Theme): mat.theme doesn't support color palettes with CSS variables
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

We are building our own token based theming with custom tokens named by our department. Then we translate them to Material 3 color palettes with the `var()` function of CSS. The colorpalettes will be the implemented like following:

```SCSS
:root {
  --my-selector-0: #000000,
  ....
  --my-neutral-0: #000000,
}

$_palettes: (
  primary: (
    0: var(--my-selector-0),
    10: var(--my-selector-10),
    20: var(--my-selector-25),
    25: var(--my-selector-20),
    ...
  ),
  neutral: (
    0: var(--my-neutral-0),
    10: var(--my-neutral-10),
    20: var(--my-neutral-25),
    25: var(--my-neutral-20),
    ...
  ),
)
```

But the `mat.theme` mixin generates transparencies of `neutral-0` which doesn't work, because the is a function which converts the Hex-Color into RGB and then sets the transparency.

### Reproduction

1. Generate a theme with `ng generate @angular/material:theme-color`
2. Change the `neutral` with hue `0` to a CSS variable which you have defined at root level and set its color to e.g. `#000000`
3. start the app with
4. inspect the the `--mat-sys-level` variables

### Expected Behavior

You should be able to insert the transparency RGB colors needed for the `--mat-sys-level1` variables into the `mat.theme` mixin to get working box shadows for e.g. buttons.

### Actual Behavior

Instead of a fancy transparency the `var(--my-neutral-0)` will be shown and the box shadow looks really dark deep and black

### Environment

- Angular: 19.1.5
- CDK/Material: 19.1.3
- Browser(s): Google Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Theme): mat.theme doesn't support color palettes with CSS variables" (#30476)

Issues.Title: bug(timepicker): Date time picker problem with form control
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Hello,

I used the new date time picker from this example (https://material.angular.io/components/timepicker/overview#timepicker-datepicker-integration) and it works correctly with `NgModel` but not with `FormControl`.  

With `FormControl`, when I change the time, it resets the date to today in code but not visually in the input. This does not happen with `NgModel`. You can find a example here : https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-starter-vhkvruvr?file=src%2Fmain.ts,src%2Fmaterial-module.ts.

And a working example with `NgModel` here : https://material.angular.io/components/timepicker/overview#timepicker-datepicker-integration

Another small issue that might be linked : when both inputs (date and time) are empty and I select a Date. With `NgModel` the time input is set to 00:00. With `FormControl` the input stays empty. 

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-starter-vhkvruvr?file=src%2Fmain.ts,src%2Fmaterial-module.ts
Steps to reproduce:
1. Select a date (not today)
2. Select a time
3. The date in then changed to today


### Expected Behavior

Same behaviour as `NgModel`.

### Actual Behavior

The date is reset to today when the time is changed with `FormControl`.

### Environment

- Angular: 19
- CDK/Material: 19.1.3
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(timepicker): Date time picker problem with form control" (#30469)
